alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 10:59PM MST until February 21 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central and Southeast Phillips, Northern Phillips and Southwest Phillips Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 PM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM to 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ranchers should take action to protect newborn livestock.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips; Southwest Phillips
